Data: Toss: West Indies have won the toss and they will bat first. Australia have brought in Adam Voges in place of George Bailey (hamstring injury) and Ben Cutting replaces Mitchell Starc. West Indies have three changes - Johnson Charles, Deonarine and El Tino come in for Gayle, Sarwan and Roach.
McKay to Powell, no run length ball on off stump, he comes forward and defends
McKay to Powell, no run length ball on off, he comes forward comfortably and drives it to cover
McKay to Powell, no run pulls the length back and Powell responds by staying back in the crease, he defends
McKay to Powell, no run length ball on the middle stump line, the batsman gets squared up a bit and ends up pushing that towards cover
McKay to Powell, no run beats the bat with one that goes across, the effort ball by the bowler. Powell didn't really come forward to play that
McKay to Powell, no run keeps it tight around the off stump, Powell stays in the crease and leaves it alone
Johnson to Charles, 1 leg bye gets some swing into the right-hander, but it is down the leg side and the batsman gets it away towards backward square leg
Johnson to Powell, no run good probing length by Johnson, it is around off stump and leaves the batsman late. Powell is beaten in his defence
Johnson to Powell, no run back of length around off, the batsman stays on the back foot and defends it back to the bowler
Johnson to Powell, no run 142 kph, fuller length but a touch wide of off, the batsman sticks his front foot out and leaves it alone
Johnson to Powell, no run on a length around off stump, good pace by Johnson, the batsman comes half-forward and defends towards the off side
Johnson to Powell, 1 run fuller delivery on off stump, it is pushed towards extra cover and the batsmen sneak a single, could have been tight if there was a direct hit
McKay to Powell, no run back of length, beats the outside edge as Powell tries to push at that one without getting close to the ball
McKay to Powell, no run a touch wider outside off, allows batsman to have a nice look at that one and leave it alone
McKay to Powell, no run another one goes past the outside edge, the angle is taking everything away from the batsman and he is not trying to get close to the line
McKay to Powell, no run length ball, takes the outside half of the bat and goes to gully as Powell comes half-forward to push
McKay to Powell, 1 run back of length on the pads, tucked away towards short fine leg for a single
McKay to Charles, no run he comes forward and defends the length ball to cover
Johnson to Powell, no run back of length on the off and middle line, pushed away towards midwicket off the back foot
Johnson to Powell, no run tries a forceful push off the front foot, but the ball comes in a bit too quick at him, he ends up playing that back to the bowler
Johnson to Powell, no run oh that goes past the outside edge. It was full and swinging and wide, and Powell goes after it but doesn't connect
Johnson to Powell, 1 run length ball closer to the off stump, pushed to the gap at cover for a quick single
Johnson to Charles, 1 wide short of length delivery, but that is way down the leg side

Johnson to Charles, OUT he makes up for Starc's absence by bowling it full on the off stump. Johnson gets a taste of what's it like to face the inswinger's at that pace. he is too late, the ball sneaks in and takes the offstump out of the ground, sends it few meters behind ... Lovely delivery
Johnson to Bravo, no run length ball outside off, 145 ks, left alone by the batsman and Wade takes it around his face
McKay to Powell, no run length ball going away with the angle, left alone easily
McKay to Powell, no run comes forward and dabs the length ball towards gully, where the fielder makes a diving stop
McKay to Powell, 3 runs wow! he goes in to the attack and plays a pull over mid-on by arching back to a not-so-short delivery, get's it just over the fielder
McKay to Bravo, no run length delivery going across the batsman, Bravo watches it go through to the keeper
McKay to Bravo, no run attempts a yorker on off stump, and Bravo jams his bat down and pushes it to the bowler
McKay to Bravo, no run beautifully cut off the back foot but the fielder at point makes a diving save to keep the batsman to a single
Johnson to Powell, 1 run back of length, wide outside off, the batsman stays on the back foot and steers it down to third man
Johnson to Bravo, no run 144 ks, length ball around off stump, the batsman stays in the crease and defends it back to the bowler
Johnson to Bravo, 1 wide super quick, but it's down the leg side, Wade somehow manages to stop that
Johnson to Bravo, FOUR runs nicely driven over point! It was full and very wide, Bravo had to stretch and he picked it up over the fielder for his first boundary

Johnson to Bravo, 1 bye 147 ks.Super quick and full again, goes down the leg side, takes a bit of thigh pad on the way and surprises Wade with the pace. He doesn't collect it cleanly and the batsmen exchange ends
Johnson to Powell, no run play and a miss outside off, there was width available but the bounce beats the batsman as he goes for a cut
Johnson to Powell, no run length delivery just outside off, the batsman comes forward and pushes it to mid-on
McKay to Bravo, no run length ball on off stump, defended towards point off the back foot
McKay to Bravo, no run comes in to the left-hander after pitching back of length, the batsman adjusts late in his defence and pushes it to the off side
McKay to Bravo, no run length ball wide of off, the batsman lets it go
McKay to Bravo, no run back of length on off stump, the batsman gets on to his toes and pushes it to cover
McKay to Bravo, no run back of length on off stump, the batsman defends off the back foot , towards point
McKay to Bravo, no run back of length, a semblance of width and the batsman is quick to push it towards point, but it is straight to the fielder
Johnson to Powell, no run length ball on off stump, driven hard down the ground and the batsman is unlucky to hit it back to the stumps, Mitchell gets a hand to it, but Bravo was just in..
Johnson to Powell, 2 runs back of length wide outside off, the batsman goes for a straight-ish pull, goes over mid-on again, not much timing behind that, but it is safe enough

Johnson to Powell, OUT caught at point! Oh no, Powell went for a flick as this was heading down the leg side and it was full too. But it moves a touch away and takes the leading edge. Maxwell at point as to just run a few steps to his left to take a dolly
Johnson to Bravo, no run short of length on the body, Darren hops and jumps and fends it off to the leg side somehow
Johnson to Bravo, no run length ball on off stump, the batsman comes right behind it and pushes it to the off side

Johnson to Bravo, OUT caught at second slip! Is anyone missing Starc now? not me. It was quick short ball on the body, wobbles a bit too and that is enough to induce a faulty defence from the batsman. He tries to fend it to the leg side but gets a leading edge which balloons in front of the second slip, the fielder dives
McKay to Bravo, no run length ball on off stump, the batsman comes forward and pushes it to cover
McKay to Bravo, 1 run stays on the back foot and turns the length delivery on off to the leg side for a single
McKay to Pollard, no run back of length outside off, good bounce on that one, Polly defends it to the off side off the back foot
McKay to Pollard, no run very full outside off, the batsman comes forward and just pushes it towards cover
McKay to Pollard, no run back of length on off stump, he goes on the back foot and punches it back to the bowler
McKay to Pollard, no run gets beaten outside off as he pushes at one wide outside off without really moving his feet, not very far from the outside edge
Johnson to Bravo, no run goes for the booming drive at a one wide and full outside off, but it swings just a touch and takes the inside edge on to his pads..
Johnson to Bravo, no run this time he is late to take his bat out of the way, it hits the bottom edge and goes towards the slip cordon
Johnson to Bravo, 1 wide goes down the leg side this time.. it's called a wide..
Johnson to Bravo, no run back of length on the off stump, the batsman stays on the back foot and defends towards point
Johnson to Bravo, 1 run quick short ball on the body, 149.8 kph, fended away towards short fine, very awkwardly
Johnson to Pollard, no run full and wide outside off, no problems for the batsman to leave that alone
Johnson to Pollard, no run another short one, goes past the batsman's shoulder as he gets into a tangle, Wade has his celebration but no one else joined in
Maxwell to Bravo, 1 run pushed through outside off, he comes forward and places it in the gap at cover
Maxwell to Pollard, no run pushed wide of off, the batsman lets it go
Maxwell to Pollard, 1 run flatter delivery on the leg stump line, the batsman stays on the back foot and pushes it to deep square leg

Maxwell to Bravo, OUT hits him on the pad as Bravo comes forward in his defence.. They are going for a review. It just spun in a bit and hit the batsman on the knee-roll. He was way forward. It has turned back from outside off to hit the top of off. Successful review this one.. The fall continues..
Maxwell to Deonarine, 2 runs floats it all the way up but it's way down the leg side, Deonarine sweeps it fine for a few runs
Maxwell to Deonarine, no run flat and spins away a touch outside off, pushed towards point off the back foot
Johnson to Pollard, no run length ball just outside off, a good leave by Pollard in the end
Johnson to Pollard, no run fuller length wide outside off, the batsman doesn't take the bait, lets it fo through
Johnson to Pollard, no run back of length on off stump, it goes across the right-hander and Polly leaves it alone
Johnson to Pollard, no run back of length on the off stump, the batsman hops around a bit and pushes that to the off side
Johnson to Pollard, no run a quick bouncer round about his right shoulder, he gets up and drops the ball down in front of him. well played
Johnson to Pollard, no run another one right around the throat, Polly does well to fend it to the right of the short-leg fielder
Maxwell to Deonarine, no run flatter on off stump, defended towards the off side off the back foot
Maxwell to Deonarine, FOUR runs flighted on off stump, it's pitched up too and the batsman just goes through with a full swing off the bat. The mid-on is up and that drops just short of the rope
Maxwell to Deonarine, no run slower, tossed up, it turns a bit after pitching around leg stump, defended off the back foot
Maxwell to Deonarine, 1 run quicker on off stump, the batsman comes forward and pushes it to extra cover for a single
Maxwell to Pollard, no run fuller delivery on off, pushed back to the bowler
Maxwell to Pollard, no run flatter on the middle stump line, punched back to the bowler again
Johnson to Deonarine, 1 run full delivery and on the pads, easily flicked away to fine leg for a single
Johnson to Pollard, 1 run ohhhh! just goes past to the left of short leg fielder. It was short of length on the middle stump and the batsman fended it in the air. It was not very far
Johnson to Deonarine, 1 run punched past point off the back foot, the delivery was back of length just outside off
Johnson to Pollard, no run loud appeal for lbw! But that pitched outside leg and hit outside leg (to the naked eye). It was on a length and the batsman missed his glide to the leg side

Johnson to Pollard, FOUR runs full and on the middle, swings in a touch, but Polly does well to flick it past square leg. Not much power behind that shot, but it has enough legs to make it to the boundary
Johnson to Pollard, FOUR runs fuller and wide outside off, this time he gets a lot of timing as he comes forward and drives it through cover
Maxwell to Deonarine, no run tossed up on off and middle, the batsman defends it off the front foot
Maxwell to Deonarine, 1 run loopy delivery on the leg stump line, the batsman sweeps it to deep square leg for a single
Maxwell to Pollard, no run flat and it's a bit short too, outside off, the batsman goes back and punches it straight to point
Maxwell to Pollard, no run goes for the big short off a tossed up delivery, the ball goes past the outside edge as it drifts away from the bat
Maxwell to Pollard, no run and another forceful shot, this time a backfoot punch to the off side, straight to cover
Maxwell to Pollard, 1 run flighted on the off stump line, driven down to long on off the front foot
Cutting to Pollard, no run starts off with a length ball outside off, goes straight on, the batsman leaves it alone
Cutting to Pollard, no run length ball in the channel outside off, 135 ks, the batsman comes forward and leaves it alone
Cutting to Pollard, no run back of length on off stump, the batsman defends it off the back foot towards the leg side
Cutting to Pollard, no run back of length outside off, Polly has taken the patience-pill today, he leaves it alone
Cutting to Pollard, 1 run he hops back and turns the back of length delivery on off stump to square leg
Cutting to Deonarine, no run angled delivery to the left-hander, who gets on his toes and punches it to point
Maxwell to Pollard, no run tossed up on off and middle, driven to midwicket off the front foot
Maxwell to Pollard, no run gets some width and he cuts it hard, but again to the fielder at point
Maxwell to Pollard, 1 run floated up on off stump, the batsman pushes it off the front foot to long-off
Maxwell to Deonarine, no run tossed up on middle stump, the batsman comes forward and defends
Maxwell to Deonarine, no run flatter on the middle stump line, defended off the front foot
Maxwell to Deonarine, no run more front foot defence by Deonarine, this time around off stump
Cutting to Pollard, 1 run a quickish leg cutter around off stump, the batsman dabs it towards third man for a single
Cutting to Deonarine, no run length ball on off stump, draws the batsman forward, Deonarine defends it comfortably towards cover

Cutting to Deonarine, OUT caught at second slip! Deonarine has been pushing at all deliveries since he arrived and this time, he tries to play a forceful shot at an angled delivery, gets a nice thick healthy edge that flies to the second slip at a good height. What a disaster. I just noticed they are not even fifty at th
Cutting to Thomas, 1 run good bouncer to the new batsman, right in front of the throat, the batsman fends it off towards fine leg
Cutting to Pollard, no run fuller delivery outside off, the batsman comes forwards and drives it back to the bowler
Cutting to Pollard, no run length ball, solid front foot defence is Polly's mantra today
Maxwell to Thomas, no run flighted up on off, pushed to the off side off the front foot
Maxwell to Thomas, 1 run slow and loopy delivery on off stump, the batsman dabs it to the off side and call for a quick single
Maxwell to Pollard, no run the slider that goes across the batsman from round the stumps, the batsman gets beaten as he goes for the big drive
Maxwell to Pollard, 1 run flatter on the middle stump line, he waits on the back foot and pushes it towards midwicket for a single
Maxwell to Thomas, 1 run turns in from around off stump, the batsman goes back and tucks it to square leg for a single
Maxwell to Pollard, 2 runs gets some width and he cuts it in the air past backward point.. that is fifty for the team. Finally
Cutting to Thomas, FOUR runs fuller delivery outside off, Thomas comes forward and drives it handsomely through extra cover for his first boundary

Cutting to Thomas, OUT oh that doesn't carry to the second slip! Or has it, they are asking the umpires. It was short of length outside off, the batsman pushes it off the back foot and gets a healthy edge to second slip, where Finch scoops it up. No one is really excited about it and the umpires are having a long debate.
Cutting to Sammy, no run length ball outside off stump, it is left alone easily
Cutting to Sammy, no run back of length, angling in from wide of the crease, the batsman defends of the back foot
Cutting to Sammy, no run that gets extra bounce outside off, the batsman was looking to play that but moved out of the way right at the end
Cutting to Sammy, no run length ball on off stump, the batsman comes forward and drives to extra cover
Maxwell to Pollard, no run floated up outside off, the batsman comes forward and defends
Maxwell to Pollard, 1 run tossed up around off stump, the batsman comes forward and drives to long-on
Maxwell to Sammy, no run tossed up wide outside off, the batsman pads it away
Maxwell to Sammy, 1 run flatter outside off, the batsman comes forward and steers it toward gully for a single
Maxwell to Pollard, 1 run flatter and quicker on the off and middle line, the batsman plays that with the turn towards square leg for a single
Maxwell to Sammy, no run flighted delivery on off, defended off the front foot
Cutting to Pollard, no run a bouncer to start the over, it's around off stump, Polly has to get under that one
Cutting to Pollard, no run keeps it in the channel outside off, the batsman doesn't bother to play at that one
Cutting to Pollard, no run back of length around off stump, the batsman defends it right in front of him, and then shows off some soccer skills much to the delight of the crowd
Cutting to Pollard, no run length ball on off stump, he defends it towards the leg side and thinks of a single, but the midwicket fielder charges in and prevents the single
Cutting to Pollard, no run bowls length from wide of the crease, it is still outside off, the batsman lets it go through to the keeper
Cutting to Pollard, no run back of length wide outside off, Polly stays patient and lets this one go too
Maxwell to Sammy, no run flighted on off stump, the batsman comes forward in defence
Maxwell to Sammy, no run slightly shorter, Sammy goes back and punches it back to the bowler
Maxwell to Sammy, no run wide of off stump, the batsman goes back and punches it to cover point
Maxwell to Sammy, 1 run on the pads, it is flicked away to deep square leg for a single
Maxwell to Pollard, 2 runs tossed up delivery around middle stump, Polly plays it towards square leg with soft hands and scampers back for a couple
Maxwell to Pollard, no run wide slider outside off stump, he goes back to cut, but chops it towards point
Cutting to Sammy, FOUR runs fuller delivery, it is driven with a lot of timing through cover, skims along the turf
Cutting to Sammy, no run back of length delivery on off stump, it is defended towards point off the back foot
Cutting to Sammy, no run back of length, but wide outside off, left alone easily by the batsman
Cutting to Sammy, no run oh be bowls a beauty this time, it angles in and then leaves the batsman after pitching short of length, Sammy is beaten in his defence
Cutting to Sammy, no run short ball to test the batsman, Sammy manages to duck under it comfortably
Cutting to Sammy, no run quick bouncer, chest-high, Sammy does well to drop it down right in front of him
Maxwell to Pollard, 1 run flighted up to the batsman outside off, driven down to long-off for a single
Maxwell to Sammy, no run floated up outside off, Sammy drives it to cover off the front foot
Maxwell to Sammy, 1 run slightly slower on off stump, the batsman pushes it past the diving short cover fielder and take a single
Maxwell to Pollard, 1 run it's a touch short and the batsman goes back and punches it to long-off
Maxwell to Sammy, 1 wide turns down the leg side, called a wide
Maxwell to Sammy, 1 run lots of air in that one, it is driven down to long-off off the front foot
Maxwell to Pollard, no run quick arm-ball that drifts wide of off, Polly gets beaten in his cut shot
Johnson to Sammy, no run back of length on off stump, defended to the off side off the back foot
Johnson to Sammy, no run angles it across the right-hander and that is easily left alone by the batsman
Johnson to Sammy, no run length ball down the leg side, it flicks the pads on its way and Wade does well to dive and get to the ball
Johnson to Sammy, 1 run back of length delivery on the middle stump, the batsman stands tall and tucks it around short fine for a quick single
Johnson to Pollard, 1 run he bowls a cutter around the middle stump line, glanced towards backward square leg for another single
Johnson to Sammy, 2 runs ohh, very close! The bowler pitches it up and the batsman responds by playing an aerial drive towards mid-on, it just clears the fielder. Not very convincing that by Sammy
Maxwell to Pollard, no run gets beaten outside off with a quicker slider
Maxwell to Pollard, no run turns into the batsman and hits the thigh pad
Maxwell to Pollard, no run he stays on the back foot and defends the flat delivery to the off side
Maxwell to Pollard, FOUR runs that is one good strong punch! He has been trying it for a while, this time he gets the proper length. It goes between cover and extra cover at some pace
Maxwell to Pollard, no run flatter and quicker on off stump, defended back to the bowler
Maxwell to Pollard, no run flighted delivery and Polly goes for a big swing, but he is beaten in the flight and the ball goes past the outside edge
Johnson to Sammy, no run length ball on the middle stump line, swings in a touch, defended off the back foot
Johnson to Sammy, 1 wide wide and very full outside off stump
Johnson to Sammy, 1 run there comes the cutter, Sammy defends it to the off side and responds to Polly's call belatedly.. There was some hesitation, but they make it easily in the end
Johnson to Pollard, no run short ball to the big man. Pollard gets under it. There is a short-leg in place for him
Johnson to Pollard, no run fuller delivery on off, it's a slower one, around 128 ks, pushed to cover by Pollard without any feet movement
Johnson to Pollard, no run oh that is hurled back to the batsman with some ferocity! Polly goes back and down into the ground. The ball was full on the middle and punched back to Mitch's left-handed
Johnson to Pollard, 1 run fuller delivery outside off, it is punched firmly to mid-off and they take-off for a single, a fumble allows them to breathe easy
Maxwell to Pollard, no run flatter on the off stump, defended to the leg side
Maxwell to Pollard, no run flighted on the middle stump, it is driven to midwicket
Maxwell to Pollard, no run pushed through on the middle, it is defended back to the bowler
Maxwell to Pollard, 2 runs he goes after a slightly wider one, but ends up slicing it over point. lucky there
Maxwell to Pollard, no run tossed up on off stump, driven back to the bowler
Maxwell to Pollard, no run slightly wide outside off, Sammy drives straight to cover
Johnson to Sammy, no run back of length on off stump, the batsman hops and defends it back to the bowler
Johnson to Sammy, FOUR runs sees the slower ball early and just lofts it over mid-on, gets a lot of bat on it this time and makes it comfortably to the boundary
Johnson to Sammy, no run back of length around off stump, Sammy goes back and pushes it to cover off the back foot
Johnson to Sammy, 1 run short delivery on the body, it comes at a comfortable height and Sammy pulls it down to long leg for a single
Johnson to Pollard, no run another slower delivery around off stump, it was on a short of length and Sammy defends it off the back foot
Johnson to Pollard, no run length ball, it goes across the batsman, who leaves it alone
Faulkner to Sammy, no run back of length, 124ks, on off stump, pulled to midwicket
Faulkner to Sammy, no run back of length delivery on off stump, it is defended to the off side off the back foot
Faulkner to Sammy, no run keeps it tight around off stump, defended off the front foot back to the bowler
Faulkner to Sammy, 1 run on the pads, it is easily tucked to deep square leg for a single
Faulkner to Pollard, 1 run he dabs it to cover off the back foot, and calls for a quick single
Faulkner to Sammy, 1 wide this one goes down the leg side, another wide. Australia (rather Mitch) have bowled a few today
Faulkner to Sammy, 1 run length ball around off, the batsman punches it down to long-off for a single
Cutting to Sammy, FOUR runs beautifully hit! It was not that full, just length around off stump, and he drives it inside out, it just drops in front of the ropes..
Cutting to Sammy, no run the extra bounce beats Sammy on the cut, it was wide outside off and asking to be hit
Cutting to Sammy, no run length ball in the channel, left alone by the batsman
Cutting to Sammy, 2 runs goes for a yorker, but it turns out to be a pitched up delivery on the pads, it is flicked down to long leg
Cutting to Sammy, no run back of length on the middle stump line, it is defended to the leg side

Cutting to Sammy, OUT caught at first slip! Another shot in the arm for the Aussies. It was length delivery outside off stump and bounced more than what Sammy anticipated, it takes a good thick edge and flies to Clarke at first slip.
Faulkner to Pollard, no run short of length delivery outside off, bunted towards point off the back foot
Faulkner to Pollard, no run length delivery on the off stump line, pushed towards mid-on, but Clarke from midwicket intercepts
Faulkner to Pollard, no run back of length delivery on off stump, punched towards cover off the back foot
Faulkner to Pollard, no run length ball, angled across the right-hander, a touch outside off, left alone easily
Faulkner to Pollard, no run back of length on the middle stump, defended to the leg side off the back foot
Faulkner to Pollard, no run waits for the short of length delivery on off, and pushes it to point off the back foot
Cutting to Russell, no run back of length on off stump, gets good bounce, it is defended to point off the back foot
Cutting to Russell, 1 run bowls the leg cutter outside off, the batsman gets squared up but manages to run it down to third man
Cutting to Pollard, FOUR runs full and it's driven hard past the bowler, no stopping those ones. Cutting tried to roll fingers on that one, but it was well spotted
Cutting to Pollard, no run follows it up with a short delivery, but Polly manages to get under it easily
Cutting to Pollard, no run keeps it there outside off stump, just short of good length, it is punched to cover off the back foot
Cutting to Pollard, 1 run fuller delivery on the off stump line, the batsman pushes it to mid-on and takes off for a quick single, Watson was a bit slow to react
Faulkner to Pollard, no run angles it across the right-hander, left alone easily.. Polly has played 83 balls!!!
Faulkner to Pollard, 1 run length ball outside off, he comes forward and drives it on the up down to long-off
Faulkner to Russell, no run back of length delivery on the body, hits the batsman on high on the wrist.
Faulkner to Russell, no run tries to take the bat out of the way, but is a little late, the ball takes the bottom edge and just eludes the off stump somehow
Faulkner to Russell, 1 run back of length outside off, he goes on the back foot and pushes it to the gap at cover for a single
Faulkner to Pollard, 2 runs length ball around off, the batsman goes through with his uppish drive, past the non-striker but only gets a couple down to long-off
Cutting to Russell, 1 run cuts it off the back foot, but Maxwell makes a diving stop at point
Cutting to Pollard, 1 run short and wide outside off, bounces a lot, the batsman chops it towards backward point
Cutting to Russell, 1 run back of length delivery on off stump, steered to third man off the back foot
Cutting to Pollard, no run short ball on the body, the batsman squats down and lets it go
Cutting to Pollard, 2 runs back of length delivery on the off and middle line, he dabs it towards short fine (no one there) and calls for a couple. Good running
Cutting to Pollard, no run whoaa! It bounced at the batsman from nowhere! The batsman had no time to get his bat away and he gets hit on his finger. He takes the glove off immediately to check
Faulkner to Russell, no run plays a stylish back foot cut off a short of length delivery outside off, cut straight to point
Faulkner to Russell, 1 run a yorker follows, he blocks it out on the crease and they call for a quick single
Faulkner to Pollard, 1 run here comes that slower ball, the batsman waits and pushes it towards gully for a single
Faulkner to Russell, FOUR runs gets his front leg out of the way, and he flashes this over cover with some power, takes them past 116
Faulkner to Russell, no run and there is another slower ball this time, the batsman gets beaten as he is too early in his wild swing
Faulkner to Russell, 2 runs more of that back-of-the-hand stuff, this is pushed to long-off and they take a couple, good running there by the two

McKay to Pollard, 1 run the inside edge saves the batsman as he went across the line to play the length delivery on the middle towards midwicket, gets hit on the pads and the ball rolls to the off side
McKay to Russell, no run waits on the back foot and cuts it straight to point
McKay to Russell, SIX runs Finch goes for the catch at deep midwicket, but ends up parrying it over the line. It was smashed off a slower ball and Finch got both hands to it
McKay to Russell, no run cut straight to backward point off a length delivery
McKay to Russell, 1 run back of length on the middle stump, tucked away to short fine off the back foot
McKay to Pollard, 1 run slower ball on the middle stump line, turned to short fine for another single
Faulkner to Pollard, 2 runs back of length on the pads, it is whipped down to deep square leg and they come back for another couple
Faulkner to Pollard, 1 run waits on the back foot for the slower ball, it is wide outside off, and chops it towards point

Faulkner to Russell, OUT caught at long off! Russell does what he knows best, he gives this one a good thwack, but doesn't get the ball of the middle at all, it hangs in the air for a while and comes down at long-off where Maxwell gobbles it up easily.
Faulkner to Pollard, 2 runs gets to his fifty with a clip of his pads down to deep midwicket, 95 deliveries
Faulkner to Pollard, 1 run stands up tall to the length delivery outside off and drives it down to long-off
Faulkner to Narine, 1 run fuller delivery on the middle stump, it is flicked to deep square leg easily
McKay to Narine, FOUR runs oh wow! Length ball outside off, Narine flashes at that one and gets it past point for a boundary
McKay to Narine, no run length ball on off stump, goes across the batsman, left alone by Narine
McKay to Narine, no run length ball, it is wide outside off, Narine shoulders arms
McKay to Narine, no run back of length outside off, Narine goes on the back foot and pushes this to point
McKay to Narine, FOUR runs he tries to go over extra cover, but edges it fine to the third-man boundary. Voges makes a good effort by can't stop the runs
McKay to Narine, 1 run he continues to swing his bat, this time it hits the inside half and goes towards midwicket and they take a single
Cutting to Pollard, no run slower offcutter on the middle stump line, clipped off the back foot to short fine leg fielder
Cutting to Pollard, no run more of the slow stuff, this time it's full on off stump, punched to cover off the front foot
Cutting to Pollard, FOUR runs short delivery, quicker one, and Pollard whips it off his hips over the short fine leg fielder for another boundary..The man keeps pushing on.
Cutting to Pollard, no run doesn't take an easy single after punching the short of length delivery to deep cover
Cutting to Pollard, FOUR runs fuller delivery on the pads and Pollard again finds the gap at deep backward square leg with a flick. No power, just neat placement

Cutting to Pollard, FOUR runs back of length on off, he nudges it off the back foot to the leg side, past short fine again. This one is surely not going to the boundary, but the fielder takes it along with him on the slide
Faulkner to Narine, no run short delivery on off stump, Narine has decided he is not going to throw his wicket away, sways out of line
Faulkner to Narine, 1 run comes forward to the length delivery and pushes it to deep cover for a single
Faulkner to Pollard, no run back of length delivery on off stump, he stands tall and defends it to the off side
Faulkner to Pollard, 1 run slower delivery on the middle stump, nudges it to square leg for a single
Faulkner to Narine, no run short delivery outside off, no problems for Narine to let that one go
Faulkner to Narine, no run tries to be too cute as he opens the face to run this one down to third man, but to Polly's relief, gets beaten
McKay to Pollard, 1 run full and slow on the pads, it is dabbed to the left of short fine leg fielder for a single

McKay to Narine, 2 runs slower slower stuff on the pads, Narine flicks it with soft hands towards square leg and calls for two. The throws comes in hard and flat to the keeper, but he just makes it back in time
McKay to Narine, 1 run slower ball outside off, the batsman comes forward and drives it to long-off for a single
McKay to Pollard, 1 run back of length delivery on off stump, it is pushed towards midwicket and he takes a single this time
McKay to Narine, 1 run loopy delivery outside off, sliced straight to point, but they take the single anyway
McKay to Pollard, 1 run back of length on off stump, the batsman punches it to cover and calls for a single

Faulkner to Pollard, SIX runs full slower ball and finally Polly opens up, he punches that over wide long-on with some power, and it goes all the way into the crowd, how easily was that done. But the ball has hit a security guard on the head while he was looking to the other side, flush on the head..
Faulkner to Pollard, 2 runs waits on the back foot and chops the length delivery to third-man, they take a couple
Faulkner to Pollard, 1 run slower short of length delivery on off, dropped to the off side and they take a single
Faulkner to Narine, 1 wide short delivery to the batsman, who ducks under it easily, but this one has gone way over to be called a wide
Faulkner to Narine, FOUR runs fuller outside off, Narine tries to go towards cover without really moving his feet, and he gets a thick edge to the third-man boundary
Faulkner to Narine, 1 wide another bouncer attempted, it's too short and sails way way over
Faulkner to Narine, 1 run back of length on the middle and leg line, tucked away to square leg for a single
Faulkner to Pollard, no run he tries to turn the back of length delivery to the leg side, but ends up pushing it back down the pitch
Cutting to Narine, 1 run back of length delivery on the stumps, Narine goes back and dabs it towards point for a single
Cutting to Pollard, 1 run short of length delivery on off, Polly stays in the crease and pulls it along the ground to deep square leg
Cutting to Narine, 1 wide short delivery, goes way over the batsman's head who was in no position to play that one anyway
Cutting to Narine, no run bowls it on a length wide outside off, left alone by the batsman
Cutting to Narine, no run a quick bouncer on off stump, he gets that steepling bounce a lot of times from nowhere, this one goes past he outside edge as Narine sways away

Cutting to Narine, 2 runs he moves outside the leg stump, clears his front leg out and smashes the back of length delivery over midwicket. But it goes high, rather than long, and the fielder pulls it back
Cutting to Narine, no run length ball wide of off, Narine leaves it alone
Faulkner to Pollard, no run back of length on the body, Polly tucks it to short fine leg fielder
Faulkner to Pollard, no run a touch fuller, but it's on the pads again, he is unable to get any bat on that one and gets hit on the thigh pad
Faulkner to Pollard, no run there comes the slower ball, the batsman spots it and defends it off the front foot
Faulkner to Pollard, FOUR runs and more slower stuff, this time it is dealt with as Polly goes back and pulls the short of length ball to deep backward square leg boundary
Faulkner to Pollard, FOUR runs powerful drive follows the pull. JF bowls length outside off and he drives it on the up, straight down the ground
Faulkner to Pollard, 1 run keeps the strike with a neat dab to point for a single
McKay to Narine, OUT he comes forward to defend, but the length ball takes the outside edge and goes to the keeper. A good hand played by Narine in a very very useful partnership for West Indies.
McKay to Best, 1 run length ball on off stump, he manages to play it down to third man and gets Polly back to strike
McKay to Pollard, no run back of length around off stump, Polly gets right behind and defends it with the full face of the bat visible to the bowler
McKay to Pollard, no run length ball, bit of width, punched down to long-off, Polly doesn't show much faith in Tino as he turns down the single
McKay to Pollard, 2 runs on the pads, it is pushed softly towards midwicket and they come back for a couple as the fielders are deep
McKay to Pollard, 1 run length ball around off stump, driven down to long on off the front foot
Faulkner to Pollard, no run he goes after the length ball, but doesn't get hold of it completely, it drops short of long-on, no runs taken
Faulkner to Pollard, no run defends a short of length delivery around off, and it just bounces over the stumps as it goes back with the spin
Faulkner to Pollard, no run pulled off the back foot, but straight to deep square leg
Faulkner to Pollard, no run moves the front leg out and drives it hard down to long-off
Faulkner to Pollard, 2 runs back of length on the middle, whipped away to deep backward square and they take the two easily

Faulkner to Pollard, 1 run that could have been game over had JF hit the stumps! It was dropped right in front and the batsmen run for a single anyway. JF gets there first and fires the throw but doesn't hit. Tino was nowhere in the frame
McKay to Pollard, no run tries to push the back of length delivery to cover, but gets and inside edge towards short fine
McKay to Pollard, no run moves outside the leg stump and punches this one to cover, he is not interested in singles anymore
McKay to Pollard, SIX runs oh now he gets the one he was waiting for!! A length delivery, angling in, he gives it one mighty swing and sends it to the crowd behind long-on .. Massive hit

McKay to Pollard, 1 run now he takes a single! He gets to his century, very very well played in the context of the game. It was pushed to long-on, he punches the air with delight, gets a good standing ovation.
McKay to Best, no run he defends it with perfect front-foot technique
McKay to Best, no run slower delivery wide outside off, Tino goes for a drive and it's uppish, flies past the right of point, there were at least a couple there, but they don't run
Faulkner to Pollard, FOUR runs makes room and crashes the length ball over the bowler's head, no chance for the fielder in the deep
Faulkner to Pollard, FOUR runs and another one into the gap, he stays in the crease and pulls it hard in the gap at deep square leg
Faulkner to Pollard, no run a good yorker on the leg stump, it is blocked by Polly right in front.

Faulkner to Pollard, 1 run, OUT another short ball, it's pulled hard down to deep backward square leg, they think about a couple, and are late into it. In the end, the fielder fires a throw to the non-striker's end where Tino is well short.
* Apologies for not putting up any comments. There has been a technical snag with that.

What an innings by Pollard! West Indies were in a terrible position early on and they were not really scoring runs either. Pollard found some support and constructed useful stands with the lower order to take West Indies to a very respectable 220. A very very uncharacteristic innings by the big man, but exactly what the Windies
Right, we are ready to crack on..Tino to start
Best to Watson, no run length ball first up, outside off, left alone by Watson
Best to Watson, no run quick bouncer, the batsman takes the eyes off as he defends it to the off side
Best to Watson, 1 run 148 kph, quick short of length delivery outside off, steered down to third man off the back foot.
Best to Finch, no run fuller length delivery outside off, Finch doesn't move his feet, drives from the crease straight to mid-off
Best to Finch, 1 leg bye 149.7, quicker length delivery on the pads, the batsman is not able to get a bat on it, it hit him on the pads and goes around backward square leg
Best to Watson, no run low full-toss, 150.2 kph, Watson punches it back to the bowler. The 150 kph barrier has been breached today..
Russell to Finch, no run bowls it full around off stump, it swings away a touch, but the batsman covers the swing and drives it to mid-on
Russell to Finch, 1 run back of length on off stump, he dabs it towards cover off the back foot and calls for a quick one
Russell to Watson, 1 run fuller delivery, on the pads, that is easy for Watson as he flicks it to deep backward square leg
Russell to Finch, no run short of length delivery on the middle stump line, hits him on the box...flush on the box. .. Painful.. 140 kph missile on the box..
Russell to Finch, 1 leg bye length ball drifting to the leg side, it hits the pads, rolls towards midwicket and they run an extra
Russell to Watson, 1 leg bye angled into the batsman, but he is not able to get behind this one, hit him on the pads and they take another one
Best to Watson, no run short of length delivery on the body, defended towards midwicket off the back foot
Best to Watson, 1 wide another quicker delivery, but this one goes down the leg side
Best to Watson, 2 runs 151 kph, length ball on the middle, the batsman hits it with the outside half of his bat, through point
Best to Watson, no run length ball down the leg side, clipped away off the back foot and it is straight to short fine leg fielder
Best to Watson, FOUR runs short and wide, it is punched from the crease and that almost carries all the way. With that pace, the batsman just has to get some bat behind the ball
Best to Watson, no run length ball, driven back to the bowler, but he picks it up and prepares to throw it back at the batsman, then gives him one long hard stare.. Watson smiles
Best to Watson, no run length delivery angling in from wide of crease, defended to the leg side off the front foot
Russell to Finch, FOUR runs short of length outside off, Finch stays on the back foot and pulls it in front of square.. it wasn't very far off from the fielder at short midwicket
Russell to Finch, no run back of length outside off, gets some away movement, Finch stays on the back foot and defends to the off side
Russell to Finch, 1 run angled in from wide of the crease, the batsman stays on the back foot and glides it to deep backward square leg
Russell to Watson, 1 run he stays in the crease and gets on top of the length ball, there is not much room but he manages to cut it to third man
Russell to Finch, no run he goes for the pull again, but doesn't get the timing right, straight to that man at short midwicket
Russell to Finch, 1 run length ball angled in, the batsman stays in the crease and tucks it away to deep square leg
Best to Finch, 4 leg byes full and it hits the pads and rolls away to the fine-leg boundary. Tino appeals for leg before, but he was the only one. It was clearly going down the leg side
Best to Finch, no run short of length, 150 kph, Finch tries to whip it to the leg side, but it is very quick and he gets hit on the thigh pad
Best to Finch, 1 wide short and wide outside off, the batsman goes for the pull to the leg side but makes no contact as it's too quick, called a wide for height (harsh)
Best to Finch, no run another full delivery hits the pads, but it was going down the leg side. Tino appeals without much support
Best to Finch, no run 152 kph, another back of length delivery, he tries to whip it to the leg side, but gets an inside edge on to his pads.. Serious pace here, Finch struggling to deal with it
Best to Finch, no run dropped! by the bowler.. It was a slower ball outside off, but Finch drives it hard and it hits the chest.. No time to react for the bowler
Best to Finch, 1 wide now he loses his direction, bowls very wide down the leg side, Thomas does well to dive across
Best to Finch, no run the pace has gone down after that hit. This one was 146 kph only and the batsman defended that to the off side easily
Russell to Watson, no run short of length outside off, the batsman comes forward and defends to point
Russell to Watson, 1 run back of length on off stump, the batsman stands tall on his toes and defends it to point
Russell to Finch, FOUR runs shot! It was a length ball outside off and Finch pounces on that after struggling against Tino, drives it on the up through cover
Russell to Finch, no run back of length, angling in to the off stump from wide of the crease, defended to short midwicket off the back foot
Russell to Finch, no run keeps it there in the channel outside off, the batsman comes forward and defends it back to the bowler
Russell to Finch, 1 run spears that on to the pads, the batsman goes back and clips it off the back foot to deep square leg for a single
Best to Finch, no run length delivery on off stump, the batsman comes forward and drives it to cover
Best to Finch, 1 run back of length delivery outside off, it moves away a touch too, takes the outside half of the bat and goes down to third man
Best to Watson, no run angled in from wide of the crease, Watson comes forward and defends it to the off side
Best to Watson, 1 run back of length on the middle stump line, tucked away to the left of square leg for a single
Best to Finch, FOUR runs fuller delivery outside off, Finch loves that length and drives that down the ground for another boundary
Best to Finch, no run back of length outside off, the batsman gets on top of the bounce and defend it towards point
Russell to Watson, no run back of length, angled in from wide of the crease, the batsman defends it back to the bowler off the back foot
Russell to Watson, FOUR runs oh yeah! full delivery on the middle, angling in, he closes the face of the bat so stylishly and drives it through midwicket with ease
Russell to Watson, no run pull the length back now, it is outside off and it's defended to the off side
Russell to Watson, no run cuts back in after pitching short of length, the batsman is surprised and he gets hit on the back leg while on his toes
Russell to Watson, 1 run stays in the crease and defends the back of length delivery, gets a bit of inside edge that goes towards square leg
Russell to Finch, no run length delivery, 141 ks, on off stump line, the batsman gets right behind it and defends it
Sammy to Watson, no run short of length outside off stump, the batsman gets up on his toes and defends it to the off side
Sammy to Watson, no run bowls a tight line around off stump, the batsman stays in the crease and defends
Sammy to Watson, no run he punches the back of length delivery off the back foot to cover
Sammy to Watson, 1 run some width this time, Watson stays in the crease and cuts it down to third man for a single
Sammy to Finch, FOUR runs angled delivery, straying on to the leg side, the batsman gets up on his toes and glances that fine on the leg side for a boundary
Sammy to Finch, FOUR runs fuller delivery, wide outside off, Finch plants his front foot out and drives it through cover beautifully, two in a row for him
Narine to Watson, no run turns from the off stump line, clipped to leg gully
Narine to Watson, no run flighted on off stump, he comes forward and drives it to midwicket
Narine to Watson, 1 run tossed up delivery on the middle and leg line, driven to deep midwicket easily
Narine to Finch, no run bowls it flat outside off, it turns and bounces after pitching, defended off the back foot

Narine to Finch, OUT quicker delivery, that goes on with just enough spin to beat the bat. Finch was playing across the line and was not really forward. The umpire gives him out but Finch asks for a review (Why?). There is not inside edge, and the ball goes on to hit the top of leg, so the umpire's decision stays.. First
Narine to Hughes, no run floated wide of off, it spins away but just inside the wide-marker
Sammy to Watson, 1 wide short and wide, the batsman throws his bat at it, but misses and it's too wide outside off
Sammy to Watson, 1 run back of length outside off, Watson stands tall and steers it down to third man for a single
Sammy to Hughes, no run back of length, Hughes shuffles across and defends the ball towards the leg side
Sammy to Hughes, no run stays on the back foot and gets right behind the line of the ball, pushes it back to the bowler
Sammy to Hughes, 1 run short and wide outside off, he goes back quickly and cuts it past point to third man
Sammy to Watson, no run fuller length outside off, the batsman comes forward and drives hard back at the bowler
Sammy to Watson, FOUR runs short and wide, that's an invitation to Watson and he cracks it off the back foot, past point
Narine to Hughes, no run tossed up on the middle, it turns away, defended off the front foot
Narine to Hughes, no run flighted and full on off stump, the batsman comes forward and defends it to the off side
Narine to Hughes, FOUR runs flat, it's short and there is plenty of width too, Hughes goes back and chops it past point for another boundary
Narine to Hughes, no run quicker delivery around the off stump, pushed to point off the back foot
Narine to Hughes, no run flighted on the middle stump, tucked away to the leg side, but Sammy from first slip runs around and prevents single
Narine to Hughes, no run tossed up on off stump, the batsman comes forward and defends it to the off side
Bravo to Watson, no run length ball outside off stump, Watson comes forward and defends that to point
Bravo to Watson, no run another length ball which is very wide, Watson chases that but gets beaten
Bravo to Watson, 1 run fuller delivery outside off, the batsman goes for an expansive drive and edges it to the right of the floating slip, down to third man
Bravo to Hughes, 1 run back of length delivery, there was width on that one too, it was smashed to Sammy at point and it hits him and ricochets to deep point

Bravo to Watson, no run big appeal for caught behind! They are not asking for a review though. It was short of length outside off, and Watson gets beaten by the slight away movement. Nothing on the hot-spot
Bravo to Watson, FOUR runs whoaa! He bowls it full and on the pads, thanks says Watson as he drives it elegantly through midwicket. No one is chasing that.
Narine to Hughes, no run flatter delivery on off stump, the batsman goes back and defends it to the off side
Narine to Hughes, no run flighted outside off stump, the batsman has to stretch forward to defend that
Narine to Hughes, no run gives it some more air and it's on off stump, Hughes defends it to the off side
Narine to Hughes, no run flatter delivery on off stump, he comes forward and pushes it to off
Narine to Hughes, no run loopy delivery on off stump, the batsman takes big step and defends
Narine to Hughes, no run ohh! That was beautifully bowled. Tossed up wide outside off, it drew Hughes forward and then turned past the outside edge
Bravo to Watson, 2 runs it's not Hughes, but it's Watson with a cracking back foot cut through point, there was width in that delivery, deep cover runs around and cuts it off
Bravo to Watson, 1 run back of length delivery outside off, he stays back and steers it to third man for a single
Bravo to Hughes, no run bowls it short and it goes over the batsman, who has comfortably ducked under
Bravo to Hughes, 1 run short of length, angling in to the left-hander, he tries to defend, but hits the shoulder and rolls to short fine. Watson calls for a quick single
Bravo to Watson, 1 run he keeps cutting of length or short of it, straight to third man
Bravo to Hughes, 1 run waits for the length ball outside off and guides it down to third man for a single
Narine to Hughes, 2 runs pitches outside off and turns away, the batsman plays it with the turn past point
Narine to Hughes, no run short and a bit wide outside off, cut hard but straight to point
Narine to Hughes, no run tossed up on off stump, the batsman has to come forward to defend that to off
Narine to Hughes, no run tossed up outside off, the batsman drives and Pollard at short cover makes a one-handed stop
Narine to Hughes, no run spinning away after pitching outside off, padded away easily
Narine to Hughes, no run short-ish delivery outside off, cut straight to point again
Bravo to Watson, no run length ball in the channel outside off, Watson comes forward and then lets it go

Bravo to Watson, no run dropped! Oh no!! Everyone had started celebrating..well almost.. It was a healthy edge off as Watson came forward to defend, and it flies to the right of the keeper, should have been held. He just fluffs it somehow.. costly miss
Bravo to Watson, no run fuller delivery, driven to cover off the front foot
Bravo to Watson, no run fuller length delivery, angling in to the batsman, defended to the off side. Bravo appeals for leg before as he thinks it hit the pad before the bat
Bravo to Watson, no run length ball a touch outside off, the batsman comes forward and defends to point
Bravo to Watson, 2 runs he gets on on the pads, just where he loves it, and he drives it easily though midwicket. This time, though, there is a fielder in the deep
Narine to Hughes, 1 run floated around middle stump line, turns away, Hughes dabs it towards point for a single
Narine to Watson, 1 run tossed up on off and middle, the batsman plants his front foot out and plays that with the turn down to deep square leg
Narine to Hughes, no run pushed through outside off, the batsman leaves it alone
Narine to Hughes, 1 run that was the other one, Hughes went for a cut, but it came into him and went low to the left of first slip.. counts as another drop to me
Narine to Watson, no run defended to the leg side off the front foot
Narine to Watson, 3 runs pushed through on the pads, Watson flicks it fine and Darren Bravo at fine leg runs over the ball, slips too allowing a single
Bravo to Watson, no run fuller length outside off stump line, the batsman comes forward and lets it go

Bravo to Watson, FOUR runs short of length, bit wide, the batsman times his cut perfectly. It is to the left of point and it races down to beat Russell at third man as he tries to stop that with his foot
Bravo to Watson, 1 run length ball on off, he comes forward and cracks it hard to long-off
Bravo to Hughes, 1 wide a bouncer to the left-hander, Hughes has no problems with that one, ducks under it and it's too high
Bravo to Hughes, 1 run back of length on off stump, Hughes whips it to the deep backward square leg with the angle
Bravo to Watson, FOUR runs woooo! It was a short and slower ball, Watson waits on the back foot and assesses the field, thinks about where to hit, and then cracks it through extra cover
Bravo to Watson, no run full, too full, outside off, Watson jams his bat down and plays a square drive, point does well to dive and cut it off
Narine to Hughes, no run floated up on the middle stump line, driven off the front foot to midwicket
Narine to Hughes, no run keeps it tight around off and middle, the batsman comes forward and defends
Narine to Hughes, 1 run flighted outside off stump, Hughes has to stretch out and he drives it to deep point
Narine to Watson, no run flatter delivery outside off, Watson goes back to defend that
Narine to Watson, no run tossed up around off stump, Watson drives it to the leg side off the front foot
Narine to Watson, 1 run flighted on off stump, Watson pulls out the sweep and plays it down to fine leg
Deonarine to Watson, 2 runs pushed flat and wide outside off, Watson punches it hard to extra cover to get to his fifty
Deonarine to Watson, 1 run full and wide outside off, Watson swats it down to long on for a single
Deonarine to Hughes, no run flat and quick, aimed on middle stump, the batsman goes back and defends it to midwicket
Deonarine to Hughes, FOUR runs another quicker one outside off, the batsman gets into a position to play the cut and finds the gap past point beautifully

Deonarine to Hughes, 2 runs now he whips the ball to deep square leg and calls for a couple. The throw comes in hard and quick from the deep at the non-striker's end, and Deonarine takes the bails off. But has he flicked the bail before he got the ball, with his elbow? Watson is well short, but they are checking how he b

Deonarine to Hughes, no run beats the batsman with a tossed up delivery as Hughes comes forward to defend, but the ball goes between the bat and pad. But WI appeal for a stumping.. He dragged his foot out, but he just gets it back in time.. And now Hughes survives
Narine to Watson, 1 run flatter delivery on off stump, tucked away to deep square leg for a single
Narine to Hughes, no run flatter outside off stump, cut hard off the back foot straight to point
Narine to Hughes, 3 runs quicker delivery, angled in from wide, the batsman goes back and glances it down to fine leg
Narine to Watson, no run quicker delivery on off stump, defended to midwicket
Narine to Watson, 1 run flighted delivery on off stump, driven down to long on off the front foot
Narine to Hughes, no run quick delivery, turns into the left hander, he defends it awkwardly to the off side
Deonarine to Watson, no run quicker delivery outside off stump, left alone by the batsman
Deonarine to Watson, no run he comes forward this time and pushes this to cover
Deonarine to Watson, 1 run tossed up outside off, the batsman swats it back through the bowler, very hard, and the fielder at long-off makes a very good stop down the boundary line
Deonarine to Hughes, no run slower outside off, it gets some bounce and beats the bat
Deonarine to Hughes, no run tossed up outside off, the batsman pads this one away
Deonarine to Hughes, no run bowls it quick around off and middle, Hughes defends it off the back foot
Narine to Watson, 1 run drifts on to the pads, the batsman flicks it to deep square leg

Narine to Hughes, OUT caught at slip! very strange way to get out. It was flighted wide outside off stump, and of all the shots, Hughes chooses a sweep. But that was too far outside off, and the batsman was beaten for flight as he is through with his shot when the ball arrives, it kisses the gloves and goes straight to B
Narine to Clarke, no run floated on to the pads, the batsman tries to flick but misses
Narine to Clarke, 1 run quicker delivery around middle stump, the batsman defends to the off side off the back foot
Narine to Watson, no run tossed up on the middle stump, Watson comes forward and defends to the leg side
Narine to Watson, 1 run quicker delivery on the middle and leg line, Watson stays in the crease and whips it to deep square leg
Best to Watson, FOUR runs full and swinging outside off, Watson stretches out to play at that and the outside edge goes flying through backward point
Best to Watson, no run short delivery on the middle stump, 145 kph, the batsman stays in the crease and defends it back down the pitch
Best to Watson, 1 run back of length, but drifting down the leg side, clipped to deep backward square leg for a single
Best to Clarke, 1 leg bye full and fast, but going down the leg side, hits the pads and rolls down to fine leg
Best to Watson, 1 run short of length delivery outside off, the batsman stays in the crease and steers it down to third man
Best to Clarke, no run back of length delivery on the pads, Clarke defends it to midwicket off the back foot
Narine to Watson, no run spins in from outside off, Watson defends off the back foot
Narine to Watson, no run tossed up on off and middle, Watson goes for the sweep but gets hit on the pads, bowler appeals, but turned down
Narine to Watson, no run flatter delivery around off stump, the batsman pushes it to midwicket off the back foot
Narine to Watson, 1 run tossed up outside off, the batsman comes forward and drives it down to long-on
Narine to Clarke, 1 run flighted on the middle stump, driven to midwicket off the front foot
Narine to Watson, FOUR runs short of length and there is some width too, Watson cashes in on it as he goes back and cuts it fine past point
Best to Clarke, 1 run short of length delivery on off stump, hits the bat hard as the batsman defends it toward off and calls for a quick single
Best to Watson, no run full, yorker on off stump, 151 ks, the batsman jams his bat down to play that towards off side
Best to Watson, 2 runs fuller delivery on off, the batsman tries to drive it straighter, but it goes off the inside edge to deep midwicket
Best to Watson, 1 run back of length delivery on the pads, it's dabbed towards square leg, but it's just a single as the fielder from deep runs in
Best to Clarke, no run good short ball on the middle stump line, Clarke is late in getting away, just gets out of the line at the last moment
Best to Clarke, no run another short ball on the body, the batsman defends. Tino walks all the way to discuss life, Clarke is not interested.
Narine to Watson, 1 run flatter delivery around off stump, dropped towards off side and they take a quick single
Narine to Clarke, FOUR runs flights it up, but it's a low full-toss and Clarke takes a forward step and pierces the gap at wide mid-on to perfection
Narine to Clarke, no run that't the quick slider and Clarke gets beaten as he plays from the crease, it goes past the outside edge..
Narine to Clarke, no run another quicker one, spins the other way, Clarke defends off the back foot
Narine to Clarke, no run flatter delivery on off stump, Clarke takes a forward stride and defends

Narine to Clarke, no run oh that is a beauty! It was quick and pitched round about leg stump, turned the other way. Clarke went back to that one and is struck in front. The only thing that could save him is if the ball pitched outside leg. Sammy asks for a review. Pitched way outside leg stump. Not a good review that one
Best to Watson, 1 run back of length delivery, on the leg stump, it is whipped to deep square leg for a single

Best to Clarke, 1 run slower delivery on the pads, Watson pushes that to midwicket and takes off for a single, It's straight to the fielder and he has a shy at the non-striker's. Had it hit, Watson was a gonner.
Best to Watson, FOUR runs length delivery on off stump, Watson plants his front foot out and smashes that one down the ground, all along the floor.. beautiful

Best to Watson, OUT that is all over! El Tinoooooooooooo strikes..Late in the day. That was a quick short delivery on the body, gets only chest high and follows Watson, who is unable to get his bat out of the way and it goes straight to the keeper, who doesn't make any mistake this time. Tino passes a sermon to Watson as
Best to Voges, no run quick short ball around the ribs, Voges was on the front foot and defends it awkwardly to the leg side
Best to Voges, no run short of length delivery on off stump, the batsman gets a bit squared up as he defends that to the off side
Deonarine to Clarke, 1 run pushed through on off stump, Clarke drives it down to long on off the front foot
Deonarine to Voges, no run tossed up outside off, driven to cover point off the front foot
Deonarine to Voges, no run fuller delivery on the off, driven straight to mid-on
Deonarine to Voges, no run flatter delivery outside off, the batsman goes on the back foot and defends
Deonarine to Voges, 1 run tossed up outside off, Voges plays that with spin to the leg side
Deonarine to Clarke, 1 run he comes down the pitch and drives it to long on for another single
Best to Clarke, no run short of length on the middle stump, defended of the back foot
Best to Clarke, no run back of length delivery on off stump, he defends to the off side
Best to Clarke, 2 runs fuller delivery on the pads, flicked away to deep square leg for a single
Best to Clarke, no run quick short ball on the body, Clarke defends it to the off side
Best to Clarke, no run another short of length ball, it is defended to the off side off the back foot
Best to Clarke, no run quick short ball on off, well played by the batsman as he gets on top of that and drops it down to off side
Deonarine to Voges, 1 run flatter delivery on off and middle, the batsman goes back and turns it to deep square leg
Deonarine to Clarke, no run tossed up, the batsman comes out of the crease and drives it to Sammy at silly mid-on
Deonarine to Clarke, no run defended to midwicket off the back foot
Deonarine to Clarke, 2 runs comes out of the pitch and drives the low full-toss down to long-off
Deonarine to Clarke, no run quicker on the pads, it is defended to the leg side
Deonarine to Clarke, 2 runs he comes down the pitch again and drives the full delivery through cover this time, Tino runs after it
Pollard to Voges, no run slower delivery wide of off, Voges comes forward but gets beaten by that one
Pollard to Voges, no run back of length on off stump, the batsman comes forward and defends it to the off side
Pollard to Voges, no run short of length on off stump, the batsman defends off the back foot and plays it towards point
Pollard to Voges, 1 run length ball on off stump, the batsman stays in the crease and punches it down to long on for a single
Pollard to Clarke, no run comes from wide of the crease and bowls it short of length, defended off the back foot
Pollard to Clarke, 1 run back of length on the off stump, the batsman punches it down the long-on
Deonarine to Clarke, 1 run pushed to long-on for a single
Deonarine to Voges, 1 run flatter delivery on the middle, punched to long-on for a single
Deonarine to Clarke, no run flatter and quicker around the pads, it's tucked around to short fine
Deonarine to Clarke, no run another one on the middle and leg line, defended to midwicket off the front foot
Deonarine to Clarke, no run keeps it tight around off stump, defended off the front foot
Deonarine to Clarke, 2 runs flicked away to fine leg off the back foot for a single
Pollard to Voges, 2 runs short ball, it was a touch slower, but the batsman goes for the pull and doesn't time it well, it drops around backward square leg
Pollard to Voges, 1 run short and wide, the batsman cracks it off the back foot, but it goes straight to deep cover
Pollard to Clarke, no run slower ball wide outside off, punched back to the bowler off the front foot
Pollard to Clarke, 1 run full delivery on the middle stump, the batsman gets a leading edge through the off side as he goes for an on drive
Pollard to Voges, 1 run bowls it full from wide of the crease, the batsman comes forward and drives down to long on
Pollard to Clarke, no run length ball on off stump, he comes forward and defends
Deonarine to Voges, 2 runs fuller delivery outside off, it's driven down to long-off
Deonarine to Voges, no run flatter on the middle and leg, tucked away to square leg
Deonarine to Voges, no run pushed through on the middle stump line, pushed back to the bowler
Deonarine to Voges, no run he comes out of the crease, but defends the quicker delivery
Deonarine to Voges, no run this one spins back in after pitching around off, hits the front pad and the bowler appeals, given not out
Deonarine to Voges, 1 run slightly shorter, Voges pulls is all along the ground to deep square leg
Pollard to Voges, FOUR runs length delivery but there is width, the batsman stays in the crease and cuts it fine on the off side, it goes past point for a boundary
Pollard to Voges, 1 run defended towards point off the front foot
Pollard to Clarke, no run flicked to square leg off a fuller length
Pollard to Clarke, 1 run waits on the back foot and cuts the length delivery to backward point
Pollard to Voges, 1 run slower delivery outside off, the batsman dabs it towards point and sets off for a quick single
Pollard to Clarke, no run length delivery on off stump, Clarke comes forward and drives it on the up to mid-off
Deonarine to Voges, 1 run fuller delivery on the middle stump line, driven to deep midwicket off the front foot for a single
Deonarine to Clarke, 1 run he comes down the pitch and pushes the ball from a leg stump line to deep midwicket
Deonarine to Voges, no run it's bowled flat and outside off, it is cut straight to point
Deonarine to Voges, 1 run he stays in the crease and pulls that to deep square leg
Deonarine to Clarke, 1 run tucked away to short fine leg for a single
Deonarine to Voges, 1 run it's on the middle and leg line, pushed to long-on for a single
Pollard to Voges, 1 run it is back of length around off stump, the batsman dabs it to the leg side and takes off for a single
Pollard to Clarke, 3 runs length delivery around leg stump, the batsman glances it past short fine leg and comes back for three
Pollard to Voges, no run length delivery on off stump, the batsman pushes it to cover off the front foot
Pollard to Voges, no run
Pollard to Voges, 1 run it's slow and slightly short, the batsman pulls it to the leg side but it goes straight to the fielder at short fine
Pollard to Clarke, no run bowls from well behind the popping crease, the batsman drives it to midwicket
Deonarine to Voges, 1 run it is flat and quick down the leg side, tucked away to square leg for a single
Deonarine to Clarke, 1 run tossed up delivery on leg stump line, the batsman comes out of the crease and drives it to long on
Deonarine to Voges, no run quicker and on the pads, it is defended to midwicket
Deonarine to Voges, 1 run this time, he places it in the gap between square leg and midwicket and calls for a quick one
Deonarine to Clarke, 1 run he comes out of the crease and drives the flighted one down to long-off
Deonarine to Voges, FOUR runs tossed up and the batsman comes under it, makes it a full-toss and slams that over midwicket to the boundary
Pollard to Clarke, 1 wide short and wide, very wide outside off
Pollard to Clarke, no run back of length delivery on off stump, the batsman stands right behind it and defends it back to the bowler
Pollard to Clarke, 1 wide another short and wide one, could have been called wide for being out of the wide marker and being high
Pollard to Clarke, no run length ball wide of off, the batsman drives away from the body, straight to cover
Pollard to Clarke, no run fuller length on the middle stump, punched back to the bowler
Pollard to Clarke, 1 run short of length delivery outside off, the batsman arches back and steers it past point
Pollard to Voges, no run short of length outside off, cracked off the back foot, but straight to point
Pollard to Voges, no run angles that one in from wide of the crease, the batsman defends it towards mid-on
Russell to Clarke, no run back of length delivery on off stump, defended towards point off the back foot
Russell to Clarke, 1 run back of length outside off, the batsman stays in the crease and pulls it to deep midwicket all along the floor

Russell to Voges, OUT caught at midwicket! It was a nothing delivery. Short of length around the body, not much pace and the batsman goes for a pull. He gets a top-edge that lobs to midwicket, who has to run a few paces backward to take that. A wicket falls against the run of play..
Russell to Clarke, no run back of length delivery outside off, some extra pace there, defended off the back foot
Russell to Clarke, no run beats the batsman outside off as Clarke hangs his bat at a length ball outside off
Russell to Clarke, (no ball) 1 run another top edge, but this goes down to fine-leg and drops short of the fielder. It's a no-ball too

Russell to Wade, SIX runs whooaa!! Sends it over the backward square leg boundary for a first-ball six. What a hit. It was short and on the body, he wound up and cracks a vicious pull to send this flat.. That made a good sound ..
Best to Clarke, no run length ball on the middle, punched to midwicket off the front foot
Best to Clarke, no run short delivery around off stump, the batsman drops it down towards point off the back foot
Best to Clarke, 1 run back of a length delivery, angling in from wide of the crease, Clarke goes back and whips it to deep square leg
Best to Wade, no run length ball outside off, the batsman tries to push it to off, but gets an inside edge to the leg side. Tino runs around and fields
Best to Wade, no run back of length delivery, around off stump, Wade gets on the back foot and defends towards point
Best to Wade, no run another quick short delivery on the body, the batsman tries to work it away to the leg side, but the leading edge drops in front
Russell to Clarke, no run back of length on off stump, the batsman comes forward and defends it to the bowler
Russell to Clarke, 1 run ohhh! It was a length ball and Clarke tries to launch it over mid-on, but gets a toe-end and it just eludes the back-pedaling Deonarine at mid-on
Russell to Wade, 2 runs short of length delivery on the body, pulled down to square leg
Russell to Wade, FOUR runs back of length delivery outside off, Wade stands tall and punches it through point off the back foot
Russell to Wade, 1 run back of length on the leg stump, flicked away to deep square leg for a single
Russell to Clarke, (no ball) short ball on the body, goes over the top, but the bowler has overstepped
Russell to Clarke, 1 wide it is a full and wide delivery, the batsman was making room by moving outside leg
Russell to Clarke, 1 run full yorker, Clarke gets an inside edge down to fine-leg
Best to Clarke, 2 runs back of length on the pads, Clarke tucks it to deep midwicket off the back foot and calls for a couple.. Scores are level now
Best to Clarke, no run he makes room but El Tino responds with a quick short one, Clarke flashes but doesn't make contact
Best to Maxwell, no run he makes room by moving outside leg, gets a quick short one and makes not contact as he flashes at that.
Best to Maxwell, 1 run back away to the leg side, the bowler angles it into the batsman, Maxwell still is able to slap it through cover to complete the chase.

Thanks for all your comments and feedback and I apologise for the technical issues from our side. We will be back with our coverage for the 5th ODI. It's Devashish Fuloria signing off from here, ciao ciao.

For West Indies, Kieron Pollard, who is also the man of the match, played an amazing innings to prop up the score to 220 but there wasn't much from the others. Mitchell Johnson bowled with fire up front and did most of the damage earlier. There is just one more game to go - in Melbourne - and the home side would hope for a clea
Australia won by 5 wickets (with 31 balls remaining)
Player of the match is Kieron Pollard, WI
